physical_appearance:This is a watercolour painting. It is landscape in orientation. It features a scene of Kampong Pasir Panjang. There is a roofed house on stilts in the center of the painting. It is surrounded by trees and vegetation. On the left
 there is a rough silhoutte of a person at the front of the house. There is a signature in black on the bottom left
 with a year indicated.

 Idris learnt from books

 practice and a brief tutelage under pioneer Malay artist
 S. Mahdar. In 1962
 at the age of 18
 this self-taught artist had his first group exhibition at the Singapore Victoria Memoral Hall.\r\n\r\n

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a watercolour painting. It is landscape in orientation. It features a scene of Kampong Pasir Panjang. There is a roofed house on stilts in the center of the painting. It is surrounded by trees and vegetation. On the left, there is a rough silhoutte of a person at the front of the house. There is a signature in black on the bottom left, with a year indicated.
metadata.subject_terms_3: Pasir Panjang Idris Mohamed Ali Visual arts Heritage and Culture
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
Known for his watercolour landscapes and street scenes, Idris Mohamed Ali’s works reveal a strong understanding of colour, depth and realism. His paintings of old Singapore are especially important as they serve as a visual documentation of our national heritage. 
Started painting at 10 and not being able to afford formal art training, Idris learnt from books, observation, practice and a brief tutelage under pioneer Malay artist, S. Mahdar. In 1962, at the age of 18, this self-taught artist had his first group exhibition at the Singapore Victoria Memoral Hall.
